source_caption_data.pre_caption: In an extreme wide shot, a person with a parachute is initially positioned in the center-left middle ground, with a large, reddish-brown rock pillar dominating the right side of the frame. The camera, starting from a position below the subject, rotates clockwise around the pillar while simultaneously ascending and tilting downward. As the camera moves, the subject descends, circling from the left side of the pillar toward the right. The shot transitions to a high-angle perspective, with the camera now positioned above the subject, who moves toward the center of the frame as they glide deeper into the canyon below.
